intro: Justicia santelisiana, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in terminal clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its ability to attract pollinators like butterflies and bees adds ecological value to the landscape.
